abstract: A program at JPMorgan Chase was supposed to protect the bank’s business dealings in China, but it went off track. | Nasdaq acknowledged that a three-hour halt in trading arose from a problem with its software. | Zurich Insurance said its board would look into the chief financial officer’s apparent suicide. | A deal on Thursday closed the door on an era of bank secrecy and tax evasion.
snippet: A program at JPMorgan Chase was supposed to protect the bank’s business dealings in China, but it went off track. | Nasdaq acknowledged that a three-hour halt in trading arose from a problem with its software. | Zurich Insurance said its board wou...
lead_paragraph: AT JPMORGAN, A PROGRAM TO HIRE CHINA’S ELITE  |  JPMorgan Chase started a program in 2006 called “Sons and Daughters,” as friends and family of China’s ruling elite were clamoring for jobs at the bank, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess report in DealBook. Although it was originally supposed to protect the bank’s business dealings in China, it went so off track that it is now the focus of a federal bribery investigation in the United States, according to interviews and a confidential government document.
